metadata.title: CVE-2024-27074 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: media:go7007: fix a memleak in go7007_load_encoder In go7007_load_encoder,bounce(i.e. go->boot_fw), is allocated without a deallocation thereafter.After the following call chain: saa7134_go7007_init |-> go7007_boot_encoder|-> go7007_load_encoder |-> kfree(go) go is freed and thus bounce isleaked.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27074` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.11.0-7-generic - 6.11.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-7-generic - 6.11.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-7-generic-64k - 6.11.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1002-aws - 6.11.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1003-azure - 6.11.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1001-gcp - 6.11.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1002-lowlatency - 6.11.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1002-lowlatency-64k - 6.11.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1004-oracle - 6.11.0-1004.4
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1004-oracle-64k - 6.11.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.11.0-1003-raspi - 6.11.0-1003.3
No subscription required
